content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-188-07-B
|Item_parent=Hypersensitivity and respiratory allergies in children and adults. Asthma, rhinitis
|Item_parent_short=Hypersensitivity and respiratory allergies in children and adults. Asthma, rhinitis
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the main occupations at risk of occupational asthma
|Description=None
|Rubric=Etiologies
|Contributors=
|Order=7}}
o Baker, pastry cook (allergen = wheat, flour mite)

o Healthcare professionals (latex, aldehydes, ammoniums)

o Hairdressers (persulfates)

o Painters (isocyanates)

o Maintenance agents (ammoniums, etc.)

o Woodworkers

question.title: What occupation is at risk of occupational asthma?
question.description: Select the correct occupation from the list.

option_a.title: Hairdressers
option_a.description: Occupation that uses chemicals in their work

option_b.title: Maintenance agents
option_b.description: Occupation that works with cleaning products

option_c.title: Woodworkers
option_c.description: Occupation that works with wood and wood products

option_d.title: Baker, pastry cook
option_d.description: Occupation that works with wheat and flour

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct option
